short_description: The British Indian Ocean Territory is a British territory in the Indian Ocean, consisting of the Chagos Archipelago. The territory is primarily a military base with no permanent civilian population and is not accessible to tourists.

health.tap_water_safety: Water is treated and safe for military personnel
alcohol_info: No commercial facilities available - military base only

weather.title: The British Indian Ocean Territory has a tropical marine climate with warm temperatures year-round. The territory experiences consistent warm weather with high humidity and moderate rainfall throughout the year.

when_to_visit.title: Not Accessible
when_to_visit.short_description: The British Indian Ocean Territory is not accessible to tourists. The territory is a military base with restricted access. Only authorized military personnel and contractors are permitted entry

when_to_visit.title: Climate
when_to_visit.short_description: Tropical climate with warm temperatures throughout the year. The territory consists of coral atolls with pristine marine environments, but access is restricted to authorized personnel only

weather.best_time: The British Indian Ocean Territory is not accessible to tourists. The territory is a restricted military base and only authorized personnel are permitted entry

emergency.title: Emergency
emergency.number: Contact British authorities or military base

emergency.title: Search and Rescue
emergency.number: Contact British authorities or military base

emergency.title: Medical Emergency
emergency.number: Contact military medical facilities or British authorities
